reviewText: I am really enjoying Battleborn but can definitely see why not everyone will like it. The $60 price tag at launch would have left a sour taste in my mouth but thanks to the release of a highly anticipated hero shooter
date:
Battleborn saw a price cut and with some googling I was able to pick up both Battleborn and its season pass for under $40.

+Solid combination of FPS and MOBA gameplay
+characters have interesting designs, personality, and charm
+engaging and fast gameplay
+mesmerizing hand-drawn visual effects
+lots of progression and unlockables
+above average options menus
+great humor as always from Gearbox
+welcoming community

-lackluster and repetitive cooperative PVE campaign
-visual effects can flood the screen in moments of heavy action (check gameplay options to disable damage numbers          and damage flashes)
-lack of visual coherence (opening cinematic art style is different from the cutscenes which are different from the gameplay)
-not enough story to become attached to the characters
-lack of pvp maps at launch

reviewText:
I hardly knew what this game was about, so in the scholarly fashion of research I took the plunge.

I stand pleasently surprised.

Performance has been smooth, matchmaking has been relativley positive (1-3 mins US West) despite a recurring match up of newer players being stacked on one team, I think this  might be so common because higher ranked folk play in squads? A few matches Ive experienced a harsh defeat due to disconnected players at startup. I find the characters and their factions fitting  in nicely, I like lore some might not but its nice to see characters with depth. PVE is similar to an episode of The A-Team running dungeon raids with Tower defense missions etc. which you can progress your career and character rank through and earn moola and gear all the while.

Ive only played a few hours but I have already recommended it to friends and I look forward to playing this game, especially when it's kinks are ironed out. My biggest wish is a better matchmaking/ranking system to even the play.

Too be continued ...

P.S. I love Thorn.

reviewText:
An incredibly fun and unique game. I've truly enjoyed playing it, and will continue to keep playing. It gets far more criticism than it deserves.

Cons:

- Optimization. Unfortunately, you are going to need newer hardware to play this game. Gearbox has stated that they are working on this.
- On-screen effects. It can be a little disorienting at times. However, it's not nearly as bad once you get used to it. Gearbox has stated that they are working on this.
- Lack of variety in campaign. I do find the story fun in multiplayer, but it could certainly use more variety. Single player is a little boring for sure.
- Player numbers. *THIS IS AN ISSUE IF YOU ARE OUTSIDE OF THE US OR EU* As of right now (May 29th), there are thousands of people playing. I live in the US, and I've never had an issue finding a match or teammates for the campaign. Match queues have been very quick.
- No good tutorial for multiplayer in the game. If you want to be competent in multiplayer, you'll have to do a little research. Luckily, the game does allow you to practice against teams of bots. I highly recommend practice before jumping into online matches.

Neutral:

- It's a complex game. Make no mistake, this is a MOBA (most multiplayer modes at least). If you go into it playing team deathmatch, you are going to have a bad time. That being said, it's deep and rewarding once you know the rules. It also manages to be fast paced and very fun. I personally love this aspect of the game.
- Grindy. If you want lots of gear, expect to play the campaign a lot. You also have to level up to unlock many of the various characters in the game. Some may love it, others hate it.
- It's new. There are some balance issues and bugs. Some characters are strong and a few are weak. This is to be expected, and gearbox releases new patches (hotfixes) weekly. Right now, I feel that the balance is actually pretty decent.

Pros:

- Fun. Battleborn is a game that doesn't take itself that seriously. You won't find a long-winded ultra-tense MOBA here. While the game is deep, it still manages to be hectic and super fun. It's a rare combination.
- Character design. The characters in this game are awesome. I've played most of them, and they all have unique and interesting skill sets. Whatever playstyle you enjoy, you'll find a character that suits you.
- New content and frequent updates. Gearbox devs are active in the community and listen to feedback. At this time, there are at least four new characters coming in future updates. One has already arrived (Alani).
- Unique. Battleborn's charm and gameplay are refreshing. I am not a fan of MOBAs in general. However, I feel that Battleborn hits the right mix of FPS and MOBA elements. I loved Monday Night Combat. This game scratches that itch.
- Graphics. The environments in the game look great.
- Multiplayer. So far, I've had a lot of fun in multiplayer. You get occassional quitters (early surrender) and toxic players, but that is any multiplayer game.

Overall:

I highly recommend it. Check out some Youtube videos or streamers on Twitch. If it looks like fun, buy it! Just make sure you have a good enough machine to run it on.

reviewText:
Great game with a lot more depth and complexity than OW and if it wasn't already obvious, the two are very different apart from being FPS games.

I have 150ish hours on record and the majority of that has been the PvE modes.
If you think that $60 /£40 for that much entertainment is bad value then I really feel sorry for you!

The currently falling player count has not stopped me from enjoying the game in PvP and PvE and I would recommend giving the game a try and getting to grips with the mechanics - its more rewarding than Overwatch's 90's Deathmatch style by far.

reviewText:
*So Far, Soooooo Good!*

TLDR: Battleborn is a great competitve FPS, full of various flavors of combat, skill building, and strategy. If you like Borderlands, the humor is there, if you enjoy a fast paced kill-fest, this is for you, if you get off on the MOBA equipment meta-game, you might want to stick with LOL, HON, or Smite. Overall, a fantastic effort by Gearbox. 8/10.

I had had my eye on Battleborn for a number of months before the open beta. As a veteran of numerous FPS's and MOBA's, the combination of the two had me salivating to say the least. In all fairness, I pre-ordered before the open beta; what can I say? I like to roll the dice every once in a while. I'm happy to report that they came up 7s this time! While I'm not too terribly big on co-op multiplayer, the missions offer something to play with my friends that are, and further, it entices them to come into the online arena to use the loot the gather in the co-op missions.
The PvP is fast paced and fun. Though there may be some balance issues to be worked out, and perhaps the overall player score" should maybe be relabled "threat" (apparently your score has really no value outside of increasing your spawn time when killed
recommended: not confirmed) overall the matches are frentic with an air of strategery that you scarcely can find in any other modern FPS. Match this with the inherent Gearbox style and you have yourself a winner that is bound to eat up at least a hundred hours of my time. If you're on the fence
hoursPlayed: jump off. This game will grab you and keep you coming back for more."

reviewText:
I'll start off this review with a TL:DR; Battleborn is awesome.

It IS NOT OVERWATCH! They are only similar skin deep. Do NOT think this is the same kind of game. This has a campaign, longer TTK and different playstyle. It's a team oriented game first and foremost.

With that out of the way I'll go into more depth. The game has a fun story mode (with dialogue that changes each time you replay the mission for a couple of times.) Lots of fun characters, 25 at the moment if I am not mistaken. So you can certainly find someone to fit your playstyle. On the topic of the characters, their humor is great. Some are rather bland but most are highly entertaining in both playstyle, artstyle and commentary.

Onto the multiplayer (that doesn't have to be!) You can have bots, play co-op against bots, or play true PvP. There's 3 different modes with 2 maps per mode (NOT ENOUGH MAPS but they are all colorful and fun, save for one)

You have Capture which is essentially hold points. Incursion which is closer to a traditional MOBA, get into the enemy base and destroy their sentries while farming and recruiting mercs by beating them at their camps and finally Meltdown which is hilarious and fun. In Meltdown you essentially escort your minions into giant grinders to appease a hilarious God and try to prevent the enemy from doing the same. Destroy, destroy, destroy.

Onto the negatives of the game, every game has them...

The matchmaking is basic as it can be, it does not take into account skill or level and you will often have imbalanced matches. If you can get over this and just play to have fun that's great but a lot of people could be turned off by this lack of any kind of ranking or skill based matchmaking.

The maps do not offer enough variety, as I said it's 2 per mode. What if you dislike a mode? Now you're down 2 maps out of 6.

Finally the game does have some FPS issues. Friends have confirmed it with me.

All in all the game DOES have lots of replayability and lots and lots of fun to be had in the MP if you can simply get over the imbalance and enjoy the humor and crazy action. It has something for everyone with the heroes. Hop in and just have a blast.

reviewText: Really enjoying my time in this game so far, I think it's been grossly underated, Everyone seem to think that Overwatch is the better game, when really, BOTH titles are good in their own rights, this and Overwatch are not even remotely alike, other than they are FPS. Battleborn actually breathes some new live into the fps genre,by adding moba style PvE/PvP gameplay. So far i have only played the Prologue and Muliplayer aspects so far, but there are plenty of game modes to keep you interested.  If you like Borderlands, it's graphical style and it's humour, this will be right up you street, well written and voiced dialogue.  Recommended Purchase.

reviewText:
I'm really enjoying this game!

**My time played is not reflective of the many hours I poured into the Open Beta**

This truly is a great fusion of Borderlands action, style, and humor (which I enjoy) with a MOBA/Competitive multiplayer focus. I hated MOBA'S as very dull and annoying games but Battleborn is the pentultimate exception!

The PVE mode (Story Campaign) is really really cool. 5 heroes (or yourself in offline play) will complete objectives across beautiful (if you, like me, enjoy this art style) sprawling maps. Now the maps are linear in nature, moving from point a to but the battles carry that defining Borderlands quality of terrain variety and fast paced gunplay that enables players to dodge and weave between enemies while dishing out their own attacks or retreating for a second to catch your breath. The missions are the same, but having played through them multiple times I have not yet grown bored because it's always a challenge, always a way to show how much of a badass you are.

PVP Includes three gamemodes that are MOBA modes, a lane movement where you try to destroy the enemies sentry, a escort mode where you deliver your robots to be sacrificed to a god, and an area capture mode. These carry the hall marks of moba's with merc recruitment, tower building, and coordinated plays but with, again, that penchant for chaotically wonderful Borderlands gunplay.

Now the game is an investment at 60 bucks and requires mission completions to unlock characters so that can very much be a turn off. Look for it on sale if you can because it is a great shooter and a great competitive game!

reviewText: Battleborn is a very good game and easily my favorite game. It is full of comedy, action, and fun. It is a great game for people who enjoy the Borderlands franchise or just wants to something to do until Borderlands 3 is released. This game has singleplayer mode where you complete a campaign similar to Borderlands where you fight bosses and other things. The Multiplayer game modes are capture: where you capture points and guard them, Incursion: where you take down the 2 enemy sentries, and Meltdown: which is similar to a moba but you will not be attacking the enemy's base. There are 25 playable character in the game currently everything from a talking penguin in a mec suit to a Fan wielding master assassin and more! Most of them require you to complete a certain challenge or reach a commander rank to unlock.\n\nSome things that bother me is that the matchmaking system takes way to long and is pretty unbalanced. Even with those 2 things I am really happy with the game. I've been waiting for Battleborn to come out ever since it got first announced and when I first played the open beta is this game just exceeded my standards and the actual release of the game exceeds even more. This game deserves a chance instead of getting put down by people who want Borderlands 3 or the Overwatch Fans. Over all Battleborn is a fantastic game and people who enjoy Borderlands or MOBAs, or FPS should definitely check this game out and try it because it might become your new favorite game who knows.

reviewText:
I don't write many reviews, but there seem to be a lot of misconceptions out there about what Battleborn is out there (especially with the inevitable Overwatch comparisons), and overall I think the game's getting much worse reviews than it deserves, so I thought I'd write my thoughts on the game in the hopes that it will help some people better understand what the game is and maybe convince them to buy it.

Overall, the core idea of Battleborn is to combine aspects of MOBAs (such as LoL or Dota) with team-based shooters (such as Team Fortress 2, Overwatch, or Left 4 Dead).  While Overwatch's core gameplay is pure team-based shooter and the MOBA-inspiration comes only from it having a large cast of heroes with abilities with cooldowns and ultimates, Battelborn combines MOBAs and shooters at many different levels.

Battleborn has both competitive and coop modes.  Neither of these feel like an afterthought, to me.  This coop campaign isn't a glorified tutorial like some competitive-focused games, and the competitive mode isn't tacked on like in some campaign-focused shooters.  Both feel, at least to me, like fully-featured, well-developed modes.

Like most MOBAs, Battleborn has a large cast of characters (characters need to be unlocked, but none require spending money - the 25 release characters are unlocked through challenges or leveling up your account, and DLC characters can be ulocked with in-game currency if you don't want to buy the season pass).  Characters have varied playstyles, including both ranged and melee characters, and level up over the course of a match like in MOBAs.  As you level up, you customize your character by picking between two or three helix upgrades each level.  These are fairly similar to the talent system in Heroes of th Storm.  Characters also unlock an ultimate ability at level 5.

Personally, I've really enjoyed Battleborn's characters.  The playstyles very a ton, and most of them have been very fun to play.  The helix system doesn't seem to have a ton of depth, but it's still fun to have some customization.  While some helix choices seem like no-brainers, I have seen debates or varies opinions about diferent helix builds for some characters, so there definitely are some meaningful choices or opportunities to customize a character according to your own playstyle.

Now, more detail about the modes:

Coop

Battleborn's coop mode features 8 missions (with 5 more planned as DLC, for $5 each or $20 total if you buy the season pass).  They take around half an hour to an hour to beat, so there isn't a huge amount of raw content, but the replayability is good.  The missions are designed to be played for high score, there are two difficulties, and, of course, the large number of playable characters.

Some missions simply require you to get to the end and kill a boss, while others require you to defend points or escort a robot.  The defense and escort missions can be fun, but it can also be frustrating if you lose towards the end of the mission because the robot you were escorting decided to move on while you were killing enemies.  If the point or robot you are defending is destroyed, you instantly fail the mission and have to restart, no matter how many extra lives you have left, which is rather frustrating.

The writing in the coop missions is also fun.  There is a story here.  It's not an incredibly compelling story, but it's fun to at least have a story in the game, as opposed to most multiplayer games where you basically have to read about the plot online.  The writing is quite funny, though, and has the same sense of humor as the Borderlands series.  If the Borderlands games made you lauch, chances are Battleborn will too.

Overall, the coop can be frustrating, but I've enjoyed it so far.  I haven't played enough of it to say how long it will last, or whether it's worth the price on its own if you have no interest in competitive, but I can say that I've found it fun.

Competitive

Battleborn has three competitive modes.  The three modes play very differently - there's a lot more variety here than in Overwatch, in my opinion, where you're always trying to attack or defend some objective and the main difference is whether it's moving or not.  In Battleborn, the three competitive modes are all completely different from a strategic standpoint.

Incursion and Meltdown are the more MOBA-like modes.  Incursion plays kind of like a one-lane MOBA, requiring your to push a single lane of minions to destroy the enemy sentry robots.  Meltdown has two lanes, but no senties - instead, you get points whenever your minions reach a grinder at the other ened of the lane.  Both modes emphasize focusing on objectives and minions, similar to a MOBA - kills aren't the goal, just a means to an end, allowing you to get a level advantage and buying time to push wit your minions while the enemy respawns.  On the other hand, the maps are much smaller than traditional MOBA maps, and unlike in MOBAs, there isn't really a laneing phase - you're skirmishing and pushing for objetives right from level 1.

Overall, these two modes successfully combine a lot of what I like about shooters and MOBAs.  They have the more complex, strategic objectives of a MOBA, as opposed to the simpler goals of getting kills or capturing points that most FPSs have, but they still have the constant, fast-paced action that most shooters provide.

The third mode is Capture, which plays more like a traditional shooter.  There are three capture points, and each one generate points for your team as long as you hold it.  No minions, and the only side objectives are some jungle" camps that can be cleared for experience.  Capture mode doesn't seem as deep as  deep as the other two
date:
but it's nice when I want to play a mode that's a bit faster and simpler.

Overall Thoughts

I've really been enjoying Battleborn.  I don't know if it'll have the staying power of other online games I've gotten into in the past
recommended: but I'm glad I bought it and I plan to keep playing it.  It has some frustrations
hoursPlayed:
but I've found both the coop and competitive modes very fun.

Pros and Cons

+ Lots of content.  Lots of chaacters

reviewText: Jesus Christ some people are an impantient bunch. They want a full fledged, fully fixed, all bugs gone, master piece. Is there anything wrong with that? No, there isn't, you should want the best from a game, especially one that started at $60, but it's not like the devs are sitting on their asses and not doing anything about it. The devs talk with their fanbase, take in ideas and problems, they talk and communicate and release a weekly plan for the game. There are, as of now, 26 characters to play as and making sure they all play their respective roles, and you know what? Most of them do, and the ones that don't, Gearbox has said they'll work on them. Matchmaking as well is being worked, they're fixing that to accomodate to people's Command Ranks. They're going to have different maps along with different map rotations, they're fixing the problems that are presented. They know the game wasn't recieved so well so they even lowered the price down. Most games nowadays have companies that make the game and forget about it, and yes, even triple a game titles do this too. But this is not one of those games, so to anyone reading, know that any problem people bring up is under Gearbox's attention.

reviewText: Battleborn had me hooked during the beta. On a aesthetic point, the art style really works for me.  The characters are unique and have distinct personalities.  Playing your favorite character unlocks you interesting and often humorous lore. For a hero shooter it's clear gearbox cares about the characters they made which definitely Drew me in.\nFrom a gameplay standpoint it has a lot more layers than many give it credit for. A successful match is about playing your role and working with your team.  Helix bonuses and gear help you flesh out your playstyle, or react to the atmosphere.  Icould gush about specific characters and strategies.  But, regardless, there is a lot of depth to each character and team composition.\nAll that said balance often feels off. Getting stomped is regrettable and usually a result of imbalanced characters and matchmaking.  Fortunately, patches roll out at lightning speed. Gearbox is attentive to players and seems to be ready to put work in.  All we need now is more players!

reviewText:
A totally unique and underrated FPS moba experience with tons of fun!
Pros:

- Great PvE and PvP gameplay.
- Really challenging.
- Wide variety of hilarious characters, which really extends the replayability.
- Stunning art with great character design and game mechanics.
- Lots of innovation.

Cons:

- Unbalanced PvP matchmakings. (i.e. 5x ~ lvl 10 vs 5x ~ lvl 90+)
- Only two maps per PvP mode.
- Few small PvE bugs like NPCs stuck in walls.

reviewText:
To start, I think videos will do more justice than anything I can type out to you. I would recommend looking up videos of Benedict. I think he is one of the best designed and most fun characters in any game ever made. Look up Caldarius, El Dragon, Kleese, Shayne and Aurox, and Toby. Look up the cool relationship between Oscar Mike and Whiskey Foxtrot. This game has a bunch of well-designed and fun characters, which I think is the heart of any MOBA. (and teamwork, can't forget the teamwork)

I love this game. I've been waiting for a MOBA/FPS for a while, and I think Gearbox delivered. As of now, the first week, there are some balancing issues, but really this is a PvP game. Thinking there aren't going to balancing issues the first week is illogical, as Spock would say.

Don't listen to some of the marketing/reviewers. This is a MOBA. It's a modified MOBA and it is an FPS Hybrid, but it is still a MOBA. There is minion farming, gear, levels, the game is character based, characters reset every game, and there is a lot of teamwork. One of the game modes plays like a modified all middle map from LoL and the other(my favorite) plays like a heavily modified standard MOBA map. Some will disagree, but I think this game is very much a MOBA/FPS hybrid.

I think the PvE is good, but that’s about as far as I’m willing to go. The missions that are there are super fun. They are the prettiest MMO-style dungeons I’ve ever seen in a video game, and they might be some of the most fun. If there were more of them I would say the PvE is awesome, but there are only 8 of them at the moment. I’m not really one for doing dungeons over and over again just to grind loot and RACK UP POINTS BRA!!!

I've been waiting a while for a game of this genre, and I am in love with Battleborn. I hope this game has a long and successful life. I know, as of now, I'm going to grab any content I can for this game.

reviewText:
No matter how much they say it isn't, Battleborn is very close to being an FPS MOBA. It's NOT a MOBA, but it's *very* close to being one. Two of the three PvP modes, Incursion and Meltdown, are basically ARAM/2-lane versions of classic MOBA maps.

That said, I like MOBAs, and I love this game--because it brings original game design, humor, and creative character abilities along with the aforementioned never-before-seen FPS almost-MOBA game style.

This game is not at all similar to Overwatch, except that they are both hero shooter" games (as the genre has begun to be called). I PLAY Overwatch
date: and it is 100% different in the type of gameplay it offers. Please do not buy this expecting it to be much at all like Overwatch
recommended: and do not be scared away from buying it because it "seems" like it might be similar to Overwatch.\n\nBattleborn
hoursPlayed: simply put

reviewText: Not worth $60. Level design feels like it was made for an isometric; the scaling just feels off for a FPS perspective. Campaign can only be played progressively in a private match, which means solo if you have no one to play with. Public campaign play is only a single selected map, from a choice of 3 of the 8 total 'campaign' maps. There's no real story or arc just reasons to have waves of enemies and boss fights, but the short animation was a fun touch. The balanced matches in PvP are too few and playing in an unbalanced match is just frustrating. Characters are locked behind a progression wall, like in a F2P game. No ultrawide monitor support - the game plays OK but menus are baked at 1920x1080. There are moments of fun, especially with the right group. Sadly, in pick-up games you can't progress with the same people to next levels.\n\nIt's just awkward and uncohesive; I'd get a refund if I could and wait until it was $15. There's a good game there, its just lacking a lot of polish.

reviewText:
Hi everyone!
1st of all if you read this review, i must warn you, my dear reader, that im an old Borderlands fan.
Lets start short from cons and pros.

Pros:
1. its really fun gameplay, very casual at 1st aproach and becomes deeper as you dig through mechanics (as almost any MOBA game)
2. I like style and graphics
3. Borderlandish humor :D its somewhat silly..ish, yet really fun
4. The world and setting. We'll speak about it later.
5. Voice acting
6. Coop and versus modes.
7. character diversity

Cons:
1. you wont believe, but amount of action happening on the screen is overwhelming. I cant play more then one coop mission or one pvp battle, bcos my eyes cant sustain that amount of cartoonish FX for long time.
2. Skins... they are awfull. Stock coloring for each character is way better. Why would anyone call that ♥♥♥♥ a skin?
3. Same toonish intro for every coop mission. Its cool for the 1st time you see it, but why we cant have some story-telling toons between missions?
4. some displacement skills have problems interacting with environment, so if u have any dashing, sliding etc abilities, you have to check twice the terrain around.
5. story-telling

Personally i like the Battleborn universe, i rly enjoy gameplay and style. Yet alot of stuff in game requires rework. The Solus sytem is magic, adn the background is awesome! (its the last Star in the uniwerse!! and its up to us, players, to protect it) however such background requires a proper storytelling, and game lacks it. We have sick into toon, but we just see some cut-scenes from it before each coop mission. (i got the idea, to make a stylish intro, like every toon TV series had, but it doesent look like that)
Huge problem is abilities FX. Once more then 3-4 characters start use some of them, u cant read the battleground anymore. All that toonish-FX just melt in front of you into totall grungy mess, so its hard to tell what exactly is active and on cooldown, and what is left.

I cant rate game with one score. So i'll separate them:
Gameplay 9.5/10 (its so charming and fun)
Visuals 5/10 (graphics is awesome, but FX mess hurts my eyes)
Story 5/10 (might change, as soon as i play more story mode)
Sounds 8.5 (its good really)

reviewText:
Battleborn is a very enjoyable game. The FPS/MOBA mechanics synergise very well, never feeling out of place. It's a bit challenging as well, so you might wanna partner up before you take on it's story or multiplayer modes.

If you've played Borderlands, you'll be on familiar turf. Classic comments, funny characters, engaging and chaotic battles, flashy colors and simply a blast to play!

On the performance side, I'm running on a R9 270X and I noticed frames dropping to 10-15 in wide open areas but a stable 60 in inner areas or small open areas.

All-in-all, I'm having a lot of fun playing this and I would recommend it to anyone, regardless if they like Borderlands or not.

reviewText:
First of all, I really liked the beta's. I played them quite a lot and enjoyed the game. I didn't preorder it but bought it at launch.

Positive:
- Gearbox vibe. If you're familiar with Borderlands, you'll feel right at home
- A lot of cool different characters with some really cool abilities.
- Game seems balanced (if both teams pick balanced combo's that is: tank - support - (ranged) assassin - DPS)
- graphics are cool (if you like the style. I do). It might get clusterfukkie, but that's just something you need to get used to

Negative:
- matchmaking (or total lack thereof). The game will without issue let you start a match 4v5. It will match level 72 players with level 2 noobs. Great fun garanteed! You either roflstomp the enemy team or get steamrolled yourself. I can count the really close games I had with one, perhaps two fingers (admittedly, I only played around 10-15 matches or so)
- Ridiculous lack of content: 2 (two) meltdown maps. This must be a joke. Plus, nobody wants to play that second map anyway, so you end up with that same map you've been playing since beta.
- Characters are locked behind progress walls. I don't like this idea. I want to try out the support characters. Now I need to grind boring other characters I don't want to play in the first place to unlock these.
- Story mode: so-so. Lot's of shooting, yeah. But why, what is the story? Jokes are 'meh' at best (not on the same level as Borderlands). You can clearly tell this has been added in a rush.
- Gear loadout: why is it so damn difficult to build an intuitive way of managing your gear? I'm clicking, double-clicking left and right, but it's always a chore to move gear in and out of your loadouts. Also, when I select a character and his loadout, am I really supposed to learn by heart what every item does? You can only see it's icon in the character select screen.
- Please order the battleborn by their role. At this point, the game is new and a lot of people (including me) don't fully know all battleborn's role. It might help if you'd put all tanks together, all DPS characters together, and so on...
- the need to grind for better loot. Ugh.


Conclusion:
This game could have been a real hit, but I fear Gearbox just wanted to cram too much into one game and they ended up with a game that's only average at best. The story mode is mediocre. The multiplayer lacks content (basically just one mode and map that everybody plays). They just shot themselves in the foot with this game I fear. But hey, sales figures will probably be good, so we can expect a Battleborn 2 in a couple of years. I do hope they focus on the one thing this game really needs: good content.

reviewText:
An incredibly fun game that will only improve as more people play it.  Personally, I think the $60 asking price is entirely justified given the amount of content, but it is important to realize what the game is before you purchase it, and this easily done by looking at some youtube videos (I highly recommend TotalBiscuit's review).  The PvE aspect offers 8 replayable solo/co-op missions that each take 25 - 45 minutes to complete.  Through these missions, you earn gear that you can use in both PvP and PvE aspects of the game.  They also act as a way to try out characters before using them in PvP.  The PvP has three game modes with two maps each (with more to come for free), all of which focus on teamwork and strategy to win.

There are a lot of people complaining about matchmaking (which will improve as more people played the game), but I have not noticed any issues myself.  It is all regional, as far as I can tell, and can be temprarily remedied by switching your Steam download region to NYC or LA.  Gearbox is aware of this and is working on a fix.

Also keep in mind that 8/26+ heroes are unlocked from the start, with the others being unlocked when you reach a certain command rank or complete and objective specific to that character.  A lot of people are upset with this, but I personally love it.  It acted as a First Chapter" for me
date: giving me objectives that I could focus on while learning the basics of the game.  Once I had them all unlocked
recommended: I felt like I had acheived something and that I was ready to move on to "Chapter Two: Git Gud".\n\nIn general
hoursPlayed: I love the amount of content and depth that Battleborn gives me.  I always have the feeling that I am progressing through the metagame
voteText: so I never get stuck in a rut."

reviewText:
While it's not a perfect game, I don't understand all the hate for Battleborn.

A few important things to note
Despite the way it looks, this IS a fairly demanding game. Keep that in mind before buying if your system is less than perfect.
Many people see the recent 40% off discount as a bad thing, which resulted in more negative reviews. I understand people being upset about that after paying full price (that'll teach you to preorder), but, for a game that's desperate for more players for matchmaking, it's not a bad thing.
For better or for worse, this is not Overwatch. This is not Borderlands. This is not whatever other game that you may want to compare this to, because it will be different. While that may seem obvious, keep that in mind before buying this as an alternative to any other title.

The Good
Fast-paced, innovative team game that stays fresh and fun.
A well-rounded roster of characters to play as, each bringing something different to the feild.
Fluid gameplay with well though-out design.
Better balance than most similar competitive games.

The Bad
The storyline is borning and the main antagonist could not have been more lazily made.
Matchmaking is a joke, but I expect that from a MOBA.
No report feature (this is huge in any multiplayer game.)

Conclusion
Overall, I really enjoy the game. There are definitely ups and downs, but I have a lot of fun playing and this quickly became one of my most played titles on Steam. I do think that more people should but it, but it's honestly not worth the full price tag. Get it on sale and it's well worth it.

Overall, I really enjoy the game. There are definitely ups and downs, but I have a lot of fun playing and this quickly became one of my most played titles on Steam. I do think that more people should but it, but it's honestly not worth the full price tag. Get it on sale and it's well worth it.

reviewText:
An incredibly fun game that will only improve as more people play it.  Personally, I think the $60 asking price is entirely justified given the amount of content, but it is important to realize what the game is before you purchase it, and this easily done by looking at some youtube videos (I highly recommend TotalBiscuit's review).  The PvE aspect offers 8 replayable solo/co-op missions that each take 25 - 45 minutes to complete.  Through these missions, you earn gear that you can use in both PvP and PvE aspects of the game.  They also act as a way to try out characters before using them in PvP.  The PvP has three game modes with two maps each (with more to come for free), all of which focus on teamwork and strategy to win.

There are a lot of people complaining about matchmaking (which will improve as more people played the game), but I have not noticed any issues myself.  It is all regional, as far as I can tell, and can be temprarily remedied by switching your Steam download region to NYC or LA.  Gearbox is aware of this and is working on a fix.

Also keep in mind that 8/26+ heroes are unlocked from the start, with the others being unlocked when you reach a certain command rank or complete and objective specific to that character.  A lot of people are upset with this, but I personally love it.  It acted as a First Chapter" for me
date: giving me objectives that I could focus on while learning the basics of the game.  Once I had them all unlocked
recommended: I felt like I had acheived something and that I was ready to move on to "Chapter Two: Git Gud".\n\nIn general
hoursPlayed: I love the amount of content and depth that Battleborn gives me.  I always have the feeling that I am progressing through the metagame
voteText: so I never get stuck in a rut."

reviewText:
so here it is my thoughts on battle born and thoughts on battle born vs overwatch...

first off battleborn is very fun to play. it has a payer vs player and a solo player or co op.
visually it looks a lot like borderlands and plays alot like borderlands. expect the weapon accuracy to be just like borderlands. that is for bullet type weapon but it also has magic users and slashers. it has loadouts as where overwatch does not.

player vs player mode has INCURSION, CAPTURE, MELTDOWN. on these modes there is two maps a piece. so a total of 6 maps with a no prefrence on a map vote in the beginning. some people have said they can not find matches. that when looking ti just sits and spins. this has not been the case for me. it in my oppinion and what i have seen is just as fast as overwatch in finding matches. i believe more maps on the way as well.

story mode you can play solo or co op. the story mode has a total of 8 maps total.
the story has evil destroying or taking planets and you need to defend them. will be more solo maps on the way
at the beginning of each match in vs or solo play there is a very short clip of anima  this hides the load up time.
i have seen negative reviews just because of this. this to date my age is bogus at the very least to give a negative on a loading screen.  that dates their age lol

so how does it play? again it looks like the borderlands game full of color and sprites. sprites are things like fire and twinkly dust particles ect. most just call sprite particles so there you have it. some say it has to much color i say to those people you have never played borderlands lol.
the gane is not optimized very well at all. for all those that own the borderlands prequal will know what i am talking about here, it feels floaty. this could be because of my aging video card but i know this thing is not optimized very well.
i have seen some say it does not run well on amd GPU's. then they list a CPU and warn people not to get the game.
ok lets learn something here folks. GPU stands for Graphic Processing Unit and CPU stands for Central Processing Unit.
either it does not run well with your CPU as some have listed or GPU not to say it cant be both but do not give out crappy information. fact is i have seen troubles from both camps AMD and INTL. that is because the game itself is again not optimized very well. if you have an older video card expect this floaty feeling to be a little worse.
now with all this said remember this is a 2k game that playes like borderlands and that includes the ADULT humor.
it has 25 characters right now but not all are playable from the start. you need to gain experience and do things to unlock the others. this contrary to the belief is easy. of course some will be harder then others but that is to be expected.

pros. 25 characters, three diffrent game modes (solo, co op, vs), visually beautiful. loot based shooter.

cons. not optimized (i expect this to be fixed), matching system does not work well in the fact that. i have played few games but the games i did play were way unbalanced. 5 vs 5 was 5 lvl players 4 through 9 the other side 12 through 28.
yes we got our butts handed to us. so no not fair at all.

thats is it and all there is.  would i buy this again? oh yeah quickly i love 2k games and been a borderlands fan since the beginning. all they need to do is optimize this game and it will be fine.

now how does it stack up agaisnt overwatch?
two diffrent games all together. yes both have 25 characters. both are shooters and have character stats. you can switch characters when you die and thats where it ends.
let Bicuit tell you... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SAMGrDUSGJU
over watch is beautiful as well and will run on a taoster.

reviewText:
Clocked well over 20 hours in beta, so this review carries over.

The ONLY comparision that can be made between this game and overwatch is that both have characters with abilities. Thats. Literally. It. You don't have to choose between the two. In fact, you can have both. If you haven't heard about this game I strongly urge you to consider giving it a chance.

You can tell that Gearbox has put so much time and effort into every bit of this game. The dialogue, the map/character detail, even the menus. The abilties of the characters and how you can spec them too. Theres just so much detail here! The multiplayer is addicting, it was in beta and it still is on actual release. Time just flies when you play this game with friends.

On the developer side, every single post on the Battleborn subreddit has a reply from a Gearbox employee. The amount that they care is just awesome and the community seems to be pretty close and tight-knit. I wish this game success and hope this review helps convince even just a couple of people to try this game.

reviewText:
I bought this game with literally no idea what it was like. I had not joined any beta, or even watched any videos. i saw some online ads, and read previous steam reviews and decided to try it.

First impression,
it has the same constant banter and witty jokes (that personally makes me laugh out loud frequently) as the borderlands series. Reminding me of Handsome Jack from borderlands (maybe same voice actor?) which is not surprising since the same developer made both games.

Game is beautiful, lots of bright colors and interesting environments/enemies.
The mechanics and controls are great, so far i have no complaints. If you like fps games with funny characters you should defintely get it.

There is emphasis on online coop or pvp multiplayer, but I played for several hours solo and it was great.
There are a ton of characters to choose from which all seem to have different play styles and strategies.
Super fun and addicting 10/10
voteText: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Great game, excellent concept and well executed. It comes from a very dead genre similar to that of Monday Night Combat which we haven't seen any revivals of since. The game offers a lot right from the word go with a well put together single/co-op campaign and allows players to unlock/earn at their own pace (items can be obtained via single player and not just multiplayer). The humour is less up in your face when compared to Borderlands and has it in the right places to boot, also poses a strong cartoony stylised graphic set which adds a really nice touch to the already insanely twisted world.

It is great fun to be had whether you're playing by yourself or with a group of friends smashing it out in multiplayer or co-op. With a variety of characters there is little boredom to be had especially as it is relatively easy to level up as well, plus characters can also be unlocked by completing side missions alongside the generic level unlock route.

Overall, the game has a lot to currently offer and is in a really good state in terms of launch stabaility and complete package contents. No problems at sight as a of yet, so a great buy if you loved Monday Night Combat or Borderlands for that matter

9/10
voteText: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Imagine Borderlands, with more creative ability-based combat in a pseudo-moba (mostly) dedicated PvP setting. Yeah. Also there's a co-op story with 8 missions + prologue that can each last up to an hour on challenge mode. And there's loot you can bring into PvP with you.

You can tell Gearbox really dumped their hearts and souls into making this new IP, Borderlands humour and all, and I think they deserve to be appreciated for that. It's a shame this game will be dismissed by so many because of Overwatch, a game whose gameplay may be slightly more polished, but pales in comparison in terms of complexity and mechanical depth.

Solid game. Recommended.

reviewText:
Well it isn't a bad game, but after playing the open beta i feel bit cheated.
I feel like Randy Pitchford lured me in his truck with nice candy ^^. And damn that candy was nice.

The mix between MOBA and FPS is great and has great potential, but as of now i can not recommend this game.
Battleborn has some very fun elements, but bugs, server issues and poor performance really hurt the experience.


I know they are working very hard fixing all the problems and maybe someday i will update my review on this, but please Gearbox don't charge 50 bucks for an 80 % finished game with known bugs.

Allright here are some pros and cons
Pros:

- It is fun playing missions with friends

Playing on advanced is great and challenging.

- Cool concept / MOBA FPS

Fresh idea. I like it. Very competitive.

- Nice heroes

Not as good as Borderlands or Overwatch but it's okay.

- Loot

I think they added this just for the Borderlands fans out there ;)

Cons:

- Lack of Cutscenes and flustered Artstyle

Not much effort in making the cutscenes. All of the still pictures between missions looked very amateurish.
The intro and outro were okay, but the artstyle looks so flustered. No clear art direction. Another indication that this game was rushed to get it out as soon as possible, beacause of Uncharted 4, Doom and especially Overwatch.

- Server issues + Always Online = Bad choice

Playing a mission for 40 min. on advanced and realising that you didn't get anything because you lost the connection to the server  Inventory Timeout" is very frustrating.
Sometimes you can't even get into the game. Very fragile.

- Bad Performance and Bugs

Last two missions and sometimes pvp maps have very bad fps drops.
Enemies are getting stuck in the map and you can't progress.
I had a bug where i was constantly losing health.
Subpar performance unfortunately.

- PVP and Matchmaking

In PVP players are leaving the match and are not getting replaced by someone else. Leaving you 3 vs 5.
Matchmaking takes too long sometimes.
Marquise exploit in Overgrowth. He can snipe your sentry from a safe place.
Some balancing issues."

reviewText: Battleborn is by far not perfect but it still an amazing experience and loads of fun
voteText: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Pros:
-Unique cast of 25 characters with unlockable skills, lore, skins and taunts.
-Wide range of gear to tweak your character's stats to your liking.
-Decent story length for a MOBA. (8 Episodes, around 30 minutes each.) With good replayability for challenges and obtaining specific legendary gear from bosses.
-Great character dialogue if you are a fan of the Borderlands series.
-Good leveling system that rewards you with titles for yourself as well as gear packs.
-No microtransactions.

Cons:
PVP: Teams will often be uneven when it comes to levels, as it stands single digit players are prone to being stomped by level 50's and above. I know that levels don't completely determine how a player does, but from personal experience a level 6 usually doesn't do as well as a level 50.
-Some pieces of gear need to be balanced, specifically the legendary ones. While their high cost to activate is a nice balance to their powers, there are some that are in need of changes.
-Character balance is also a problem. Some characters go untouched in PVP due to the fact that there are characters that do their job better. It is because of this that you will usually see the same set of characters on a team in a PVP match. There are also those that are considered overpowered. We have received a few balancing changes on some characters but others are still in need of it.
-Performance is an issue to many users, even to those with setups that rocket past the recommended system requirements. A lot of the lag comes from the story missions. As an example, on the second mission, I get 100+ frames through most of the level, however there are spots on the map, where if I walk into them, while staring at the exact part of the map where I was just standing, my frame rate will drop down to a locked 30. I have also had several others with rigs better than mine walk in the same spot as to replicate the anomaly, and even they had large frame rate dips. Which begs the question: Why?". As far as PVP goes I have had little to no frame rate drops. At most dipping to the 50's in the heat of battle.

I wish i could mark this game as a mixed
date: but I will mark this game as not recommended until some of the problems are addressed in later updates."

reviewText: I'm gonna be honest here, I am a Gearbox fan - l love the Borderlands series to death. There are a lot of really negative reviews about this game on here, but keep in mind this is around the first week of release. This game is a AAA title, many of which have had horribly rocky starts but have still been very successful (I'm looking at you Battlefield 4). Too many people expect a 100% polished game on release, but this is 2016, that kind of thing doesn't happen anymore - just accept it. I admit there are some serious problems in the online multiplayer: few OP characters, bad matchmaking, etc.; however, the Devs at Gearbox have been on top of things. There has already been a few hotfixes and a patch coming sometime next week-ish that hopefully fixes a lot of these problems. My friend and I have actually played with a Dev solo queuing in game; Gearbox is really working on making this game even better than it already is. This kind of dedication from the developers isn't seen too often. The whole point of this little rant is that the game has its issues, but give it some time and I am sure this game will be just as everyone hoped it would be.
voteText: 7 of 12 people (58%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Very solid gameplay. Evidently, the gameplay-mechanics have had some serious work done on them, the helix-skill-system works as marketed, and the gun-play has a nice, somewhat organic, feel to it. Additionally, both the in-game, animated 3D, and 'especially' the hand-drawn anime-styled chinematics, are among the most well-made I've ever seen, and are very immersive.

As a point of reference as to the general feel of the gameplay; the online game-modes and overall experience is quite reminiscent of games like Team Fortress 2, Super Monday Night Combat, and the upcomming game, Overwatch, by Blizzard. The campaign, on the other hand, is more reminiscent of games in the Borderlands IP, which should not come to anyone's big suprise, given that Battleborn is made by the same developer. The feel of coop-story-mode is quite a break from the norm too; there is a wide variety of experiences provided, linear story missions, boss-battles, and the tower-defence experiences, which especially, make for a real blast.

If you like Borderlands, SMNC, or Overwatch, I would definately recommend that you take a shot at Battleborn. It is a really solid game.

This system gives you stuff to work towards and customization that other games *cough* overwatch *cough* do not have.  These items can not only be obtained with the games "currency" but also by playing the single player by yourself or with friends.\n\nFinally

reviewText:
Thumbs up for this game.

I play PvE only and a lot of people say this is a PvP Multiplayer game with some underwhelming PvE and solo-play elements.

I personally disagree, but it depends on your playstyle I guess. I can only play 1-2h per day and usually I play 1-2 maps. I do not need a big story and the solo gameplay is fine for me. Always something that keeps me engaged to replay the maps...go for silver/gold, unlock heroes, grind some loot and experience, etc.. Some may find that shallow, I find it satisfying and engaging enough.

Multiplayer PvE is great, no problems so far with random groups. Playing with friends is a blast of course!

I only have a medicore system and game runs smooth on high settings.

Pros:
- Heroes offer a vast variety of playstyles: Sniper, Tank, Melee, Hybrid...you name it they have it
- You need to adapt your playstyle for each hero
- satisfiyng grind for loot, lvl-ups, rewrds, unlocks, ratings, etc.
- easy to play and get into, but challenging on higher difficulty/hardcore
- good gunplay and shooter mechanics
- solo play und multiplayer PvE is fun to play (for me)

Cons:
- some escort missions can be stressful/tricky on the first attempts
- 8 Maps only for PvE so far (more to come, but DLC policy)
- pay for DLC´s

Verdict:

Is it worth the price? For me yes, because I get enough out of it (and thats solo and PvE only). But I can also see some flaws and it is far from perfect, but really great fun to play so far. If you are unsure wait for a discount, if you also like to play PvP then go for it, obviously most people think it shines even more on that side.
I do despise the pay-for-DLC-policy, but I will wait to judge on that until they show up and then try to get them on a good discount.

reviewText:
Shut up & Go and give Gaben your money already! This game has been heavily under the radar,.. 10/10 must get.

What is battleborn? (pro's and con's beneath)

A tremendous band of badass heroes fight to protect the universe's very last star from a mysterious evil in this next-gen shooter by the creators of Borderlands. To defend it, you'll need to utilize every type of character and weapon you've ever imagined -- from cyborg hawkmen to samurai vampires to mini-gun wielding man-mountains. Slash and parry, run and gun, cast and dash, or simply obliterate foes all while building and growing your personal team of heroes. Choose your hero and fight alone or co-operatively alongside friends in story missions, or battle against them in fast-paced competitive multiplayer matches.

pro's:

- If you loved borderlands franchise you will love this!
- The campaign can be played solo or co-op
- Loads of replayability
- PvP is moba-esque
- Easy to pick up
- Not pay to win
etc...

only con:
- Frame rate can change rapidly (Problem with AMD's, should get patch soon to fix)

reviewerDisplayName: Ja, schon acht Bier am Tag.
reviewText:
The decision of the Tracer's-Back-loving community seems to have been made already. The hype for OVERWATCH is uber, BATTLEBORN comes around as the less polished funny little twink.
But alas, the com got it all wrong. Now the impossible (ask the media-payed online magazines) comparison to OVERWATCH.
Here we go.

+++ Heroes and Abilities

Points for BATTLEBORN. The heroes in OVERWATCH have in average fewer abilities and in average less intriguing abilities than the heroes of BATTLEBORN. There is no QWE+ULTIMATE for every OVERWATCH hero. Some can more or less shot and jump. Meeh. But nice butts though.

In BATTLEBORN you have the helix - meaning you can play every hero in very different ways. There is no such option in OVERWATCH. The heroes have generic roles and do nothing else than this one design.
I call the design of the BATTLEBORN heroes superior to OVERWATCH's heroes.

+++ Gameplay depth

Games can end in 5 minutes! What does that mean? Kill the following (very exciting) possibilities: no comebacks in OVERWATCH. No delaying/evading strategies because there is no leveling.
The gameplay in OVERWATCH is generic. It just is. Don't fool yourself.
There is only one boring mode - capture two points and call your Bastion. Bam bam - game over.

And the maps! The maps in BATTLEBORN I maybe call it's main weakness - the design is okay and works, but not especially intentive. But in OVERWATCH the maps are completely bonkers and lame tubes - you start in base, you have twenty seconds before you meet the enemies' base entry and NO KIDDING: you can basically spawn camp them. This is just bad design.

Every graphic detail of OVERWATCH is meaningless, it adds nothing to the gameplay and is really surface. Running and climbing and jumping around in OVERWATCH is like swimming in plastic.

Many people call BATTLEBORN confusing - there is too much going on. I think that is a very sad notion. Instead of asking yourself if you're maybe a little too slow mentally, or just investing more energy (not even time!) in trying to understand a game, you blame the game. This is an development in gaming that will end in boring and polished game with zero immersion. Immersion starts where you have to learn the ropes, where you even have to give something from you to the game - this is why old-school RPGs like Baldur's Gate were great. The design philosophy of games like OVERWATCH would have called this game to be too hard" and "too frustrating" for gamers and would polish everything.

+++ Endgame and Meta

There is gonna be a hardcore heavy meta upcoming for OVERWATCH. For anybody who wants to play with his friends and copy the latest Blizzcon winners because the gameplay really
does only allow one style if you want to play on a successful level.

There is gonna be Tier1
date: Tier2 and Tier3 strategies/hero choices. And you gonna go and play like the meta calls it or you fail.\n\nIn BATTLEBORN
recommended:
we have the same risk of meta-based and lastly boring gameplay. But Gearbox has reacted fast to the community calls and nerfed Ambra which was far too strong and would have dominated the meta otherwise.

I have high hopes for a sane meta in BATTLEBORN since the designers seem to be paying attention. This can't be said for the OVERWATCH designers. They pretty much ♥♥♥♥ed it up with HEROES OF THE STORM and the design philosophy for OVERWATCH seems to be the same.
Games must flow like gummy bears - detect and delete all obstacles please
hoursPlayed:
Mr Lead Designer. Games must be designed for braindead zombies. Didn't you see the sales?

+++ Resumé

Well
voteText: here I end my review. Recommendation for BATTLEBORN if you're interested in a complex
helpfulPercent: yet not frustrating and intense gameplay that you and your friends can really dig in."

reviewText:
Ok, so i've edited my review, maybe now it will be more clear what i want to say about this game.
Main issues:
1. Oversaturation of colors makes it hard to play for me, i have something wrong with my right eye and it gets tired too hard (it gets tired even if i drive in the evening from the lights around me).
2. Playing a melee battleborn in a multiplayer mode is a pain in the ♥♥♥ because it is unreadable most of the time. As an avid moba player i find this unacceptable.
3. FPS issues are still there, they are unbearable in one single player mission, somewhat bearable in others, and mostly decent in multiplayer. Phenom 2 1075, HD 7970, 8gb ram.
4. I've never encountered a hacker while i was playing but reading subreddit makes me sad that there are hackers. I thought that would become an issue since you are using the same engine as in Bornderlands.
5. Single player campaign is a marketing move and a joke, it doesn't stand up to what it was hyped for. The only two legit interesting missions we already seen during free play time. Every mission after that isn't good at all.
6. I had to replay co-op campaign three times because one enemy monster fell under the texture and we could not kill him (Talking about playing the game for 8 hours here, lmao).
7. Sound is poor. Music isn't setting the tone and can't support the pace. Sometimes it is too quiet for no reason. In game sound doesn't speak to the player about what is going on around him. In other co-op (moba mostly) games sound helps the player to recieve important information about current state of the battle, in battleborn this isn't working at all.

So other minor issues:
Matchmaking isn't here, if it is - it doesn't work. How does score system works is a riddle too, it's hard to keep myself in game if i have only 2 score points while at the same time i've been runing around objectives like a dingo while also saving my teammates as Boulder.  Some mechanics were never explained to the player which makes it even harder to learn to play. Hero unlocking systen isn't justified and it reminds me of Call of Duty MW 1 and 2, which was 10 years ago and was fine back then, but now it doesn't do any good for the game. By the way why am i forced to watch intro cuntscene and play prologue again after i log in from my laptop? And as a final note some legendary items are plain broken, which makes some battleborn broken especially against inexperienced players.

reviewText:
For me this game is amazing because I love the replaying the co-op campaign with different heroes. However, I would not bother buying it for the competitive mode.

My favorite heroes
-heavy weapons
-Barack Obama
-witchblade elf
-space marine
-dark samus
-sith lord
-skynet

My critique of the co-op campaign
-mission 1: good
-mission 2: good
-mission 3: too repetitive
-mission 4: good
-mission 5: good
-mission 6: too repetitive
-mission 7: too repetitive
-mission 8: good

A list of issues:

1) There is way too much grind for a game with so little content because leveling up the heroes takes forever.

2) Both the heroes and the enemies can get stuck in the co-op campaign maps and this can be game breaking.

3) The heroes are extremely unbalanced and because of this the competitive mode seems to be broken.

4) It is difficult to get a full team because players disconnect and then the game never adds new players.

5) This game desperately needs more missions and maps.

reviewText:
Pros:
- Nice selection of hereos
- Runs very smooth/nice graphics
- MOBA with FPS elements


Cons:
- Almost impossible to achieve silver ranking, solo, on advanced campaign which is needed to unlock the last 3 heroes. On top of that if you matchmake campaign it will not allow you to change difficulty.
- Some heroes need some balancing. People are arguing that they need to learn the game; If all it takes is for someone to run up and hack and slash and kill you more than half the time, I would say there are some issues.
- Matchmaking is not very good; almost always will not have a good spread of command rank. I do understand that players cannot be evenly spread all the time but to atleast have some consistency would be nice.
- Lack of staying with a party. Very rarely I will find myself playing with a nice group of people who openly communicate and play as a team, but cannot play another game with them because you have to re enter matchmaking everytime you win/lose a game.
- Lack of multiplayer maps and content. Hopefully dlc will fix but this is definately not $60 worth of content.
- Scoring in multiplayer needs to emphasis objectives. Too many people thinking kills > objectives.
- Campaign is a little lackluster and seems rushed. Not a real vareity in gameplay. You're either defending something with waves or just escorting. Where is the creativity that was in borderlands 2?

Overall I would recommend this game despite the huge list of cons because I do see the potential that this game has. When you do finally matchmake with players who work as a team it really is very fun. Hopefully we can get a good player base to increase better matchmaking in multiplayer

reviewText:
Battleborn is an extremely underrated game for what it is, and is actually really well executed with a wide cast of characters and humorous dialogue.

There's been a wave of mockery and false accusations about the whole game, such as it having microtransactions and such, but it's actually completely clear of microtransactions, and the only DLC is a season pass that gives you the new characters instantly on release, instead of having to unlock them through progression.

Really, this is actually a refreshing team-based FPS with quite a lot of variety of how to play the characters, since pretty much every character is actually completely unique in terms of how to play. Support characters aren't all about healing, but can also be hybrid damage dealers, deal increased damage to shields, be better at crowd control, etc.

I'd honestly say this is a very nice breath of fresh air from a AAA dev, considering literally every damn AAA game these days has microtransactions one way or the other, whereas you literally don't have any for this game, not even loot boxes - those are only bought for Credits you get for playing matches or doing challenges.

This comes from a person who enjoys both Battleborn AND Overwatch, and I really have nothing against Overwatch despite the overshadowing of its competition.
You can enjoy either, or both, if you really want to - I know I will do the latter.
voteText: 9 of 16 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Battleborn is a lot of fun with a ton of potential, sadly it has some issues but generally it's an excellent game.

Now to address the elephant in the room, everyone seems to compare this to Overwatch, Overwatch is a great game but it's very much like TF2, you have 2 teams, you kill each other.. it's pure, simple PvP and that can be a lot of fun, Battleborn is more tactical, deciding when and how to engage, whether to buy gear, build turrets, whether your hero gets countered by another then if you should engage anyway or not.. it's very much like a mix between Borderlands and DOTA 2, easy-ish to learn and hard to master.

reviewText: I love this game. The missions are super fun, and the writing in them is hilarious. The PVP is really well made too, and the huge roster of characters makes things different every time you play. I know I'm going to play this for a long time, if they keep supporting it.
voteText: 10 of 18 people (56%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
surprisingly i really like it

+the characters i've got to play already are varied and interesting with cool abilities.
+i've only played the multiplayer moba mode and it was a lot of fun
+graphics & sound are awesome
+the fps mechanics are quite solid
+knowing gearbox there will be a lot of updates, constantly new characters, and maps.

some of the minuses
-fps can drop during some games for no apparent reason, and i have the fastest possible rig you can get
-unlocking characters seems a bit grindy.
-since most of the characters are unlocked with achievments & certain progress you can get shoehorned into playing modes you don't necessarily want to play.
-co-op seems to be giving a disproportionated amount of gear to the pvp
-knowing gearbox there will be a lot of updates, constantly new characters and maps... i put it as a minus as well since it will all be paid and there are people that do not like that.
-a bit too expensive

some balance concerns (might be invalid since i haven't played that much)
buildables can be a little bit more durable and do more dmg/healing
buildables can be in weird positions
maybe a couple of more item slots since 3 items is kind a limiting + you can't do different builds in the same game

Anyway, bottom line is, I had a hard time stopping playing tonight and this is rare novadays.

p.s. also i've been in overwatch beta and stuff, and i feel the fps mechanics are about equal between the two. characterwise i can't really say since i haven't tried that many characters here but from what I have seen they are equal altough maybe i've enjoyed the ones here a bit more. gfx, sound, and art style are super similiar altough battleborn can be a bit more cluttered at times.

however, battleborn completely blows overwatch out of the water in game modes department, co-op, item variety, in-match leveling choices and obviously sp & co-op.

personally i've gotten both but if i had to choose right now i would go with battle born for sure.

reviewText: Hey just as a heads up for everyone who is getting the game, and then complaining about the game with only 0.2 hours on your account, remember that you should ALWAYS go into the settings menu before you play a game for the first time! It's especially imporant to do this when games (like this one) are ported over from the consoles, and have framerate limitations as to not be a hinderance on the consoles. Make sure that you enable unlimited framerate before you head straight to the steam store page and DEMAND that the game is fixed, or be as brash as to request a refund before EVEN MESSING WITH THE GRAPHICAL SETTINGS. Go back to your damned precious console if you're going to just go straight into complaining about something without even making a valid attempt to fix an issue.\n\nTLDR; The game is awesome, go into settings before you play the game, and the prologue is about 20 minutes long. You'll survive.

reviewText: The truth of the matter of Overwatch vs Battleborn is simple. They have very different gameplay ethos but trade off similar mechanics and character designs. Oh even that is more explanation than is required though. Overwatch is a fancy three course dinner at a nice restaurant while Battleborn is stuffing your face with a bag full of dollar menu hamburgers. There really is no reason I should want the bag of greasy junk food over the nice meal, but sometimes you just want the junk food.. Battleborn is that greasy mess that you sometimes just need to indulge.

reviewText:
Do you like Borderlands?
Do you like MOBA's like SMITE, League of Legends etc.?
Do you like co-op games?
Do you like unique characters?
Do you like to slaughter hordes of enemies?
Do you like cartoon graphics?

If your answer is yes to atleast 4 out of 6 questions then consider buying this game.

reviewText:
Well, well, well.. So let's see. As far as I can see it right now, after 80+ hours of gameplay, this game is pretty much amazing. There are still a lot of problems, lacks of content and connection errors sometimes, but anyway, who cares about it, when you have fun, playing with your friends the game from the creators of legendary Borderlands.

Anyway, to sum up everything.
Pros:
+ Nice animated graphic
+ Epic cutscenes in a story mode
+ Borderlands inspired
+ Challenging lores to complete
+ Fun and entertaining gameplay
+ 25 totally different and unique characters
+ Story mode really worth playing

Cons:
- NO RANKED GAMES. this is embarassing,hope this is not gonna last forever.
- Sometimes matchmaking gets an unexpected error for no reason and this is annoying
- Some people says it's unbalanced in PVP, but I can't say it's true
- Only 8 missions in a story mode.. after enormous Borderlands world it looks very stupid and embarassing
voteText: 40 of 77 people (52%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I desperately wanted to like this game, though after a handful of hours I can say that I would not recommend this game (in it's current state) to others.

-Pros-
+ Great, colorful and vibrant environments
+ Varied roster
+ Fun blend of MOBA, FPS and Horde gameplay
+ Stats on stats on stats on stats on stats (hopefully you like stats)
+ Tons of unlocks

-Cons-
- Uninspired graphics
(while colorful, most aspects of the levels, characters and effects look basic and dull)
- No checkpoints or team retries
(It is baffling that you can spend 35 minutes working through a Story mode level with a team, and fail an objective and simply be dumped back to the main menu - no retry vote, the team is disbanded, and there is little indication of what exactly was the cause of the objective failure)
- Selecting an indvidual story mission is much too difficult
- No hop-out/hop-in multiplayer
(if someone quits out, your team is stuck fighting at a higher mob quantity for the remainder of the mission...No one else can jump in and your team is effectively handicapped)
- I paid for the product, yet I have to jump through hoops to unlock a majority of the characters
( I like earning characters, but I dont want to be limited to 6 characters right out of the gate...It makes the game feel really limited until you can gather the right team or get lucky and beat the one Story mission you have been hunting for hours in order to unlock the next character.)
- Bland humor.
(I really wanted to like the humor, but it becomes monotonous and repeats itself REALLY quickly.  You will hear almost all of your character's dialouge in the first story mission or match you play... lots of repeating).
- Repeatitive cutscenes
(The intro animation is repeated EVERY SINGLE TIME you play a mission.  The same little hand animated interstitial scene is also repeated virbatim EVERY SINGLE TIME you play any game.)


I feel like this is a free to play game in look and feel, that was restructured late in development to be full priced (I know this is not the case, but the problem is that this is how it feels right now).  I cannot say that I feel like this is worthy of $60 at this time.
voteText: 10 of 18 people (56%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is not a traditional review, this is my personal experiences and opinion and also some facts based on my experience in 25 years of gaming.

Game Content.

The game has very little content, and is very grindy. It will take many hours of repeating the same missions over and over to even unlock all the characters, then you need to decide which one you like but cant really decide until you played them all and then you need to grind some more to level up that specific charcter before you can decide if its any good.

All in all, its a grind fest with minimal content, and sub par performance. Before you have unlocked everything and died of bordem doing it, there will be a DLC that you will have to buy and grind some more. This game will die.

Game Performance.

Here is a video of my game experience. I am playing single player, with FPS at the top left, In my opinion it looks like an Xbox 360 game and notice how it goes from 60 down to 14, 17 , 30 etc, its very jaring and makes me dizzy with all the effects and when I try to aim it feels like the cross hair is floating and lagging behind my movement.

This is with all the settings off or on low, I show the settings at the end.

I challenge anyone to show me smooth gameplay without jarring fps drops, of course you have to show the fps in real time, like I did.

https://vid.me/b799

Intel Core i5 4670k@ 4ghz
16GB Ram
2 x amd 7950
Intel 730 SSD
Only battle born steam, MSi after burner and OBS.

My experience is the same if I am recording or not, I am recording to a seperate hard disk and the game uses around 30% of my cpu.

Multiplayer, anit-cheat or lack of.

Battleborn the Zero anti cheat game.
Does this game use VAC? No
Does this game use any third-party anti cheat software at all? No
Does this game use proprietary anti cheat software? No
Are the developers collecting statistics? Don't know.
Has anyone been banned yet? No(there have been paid hacks available since closed beta)
Can you attach a debugger to the game without a problem? Yes.
Does this game have sensitive game data client side? Yes. Teleport and recoil/no spread and other things are handled client-side and can be manipulated.

Can you change gravity by editing the ini file? Yes

Correct me if you have proof of any of the things I said being incorrect.

reviewText: This game is fun, it's worth your time.  It's lacking content.  It's charging AAA price and using a F2P content unlocking format.  Don't pay full price.  New characters will be added free of charge!"  *but you can unlock them early if you pay more money

reviewText:
This game is overflowing with character and humor. Its an extremely polished and smooth FPS fun ride. Just under 6 hours so far and im having a blast. Was a little sceptical due to Gearbox's recent failures other than their Borderlands series but Battleborn proves that Gearbox excels at this type of game. Its nothing like Overwatch (though Overwatch is also a great title) even though most will be quick to compare the two since they are both FPS games. I enjoy both and will be playing both for some time.

Battleborn's DLC, in the fairly cheap 19.99 Season Pass, is only going to be campaign oriented. It was already stated all multiplayer DLC such as maps and new characters will be free. No microtransactions or P2W here.

So if you are looking for a solid FPS title with tons of humor and action, love Gearbox's over the top humor and action like the borderlands series, or just passing the time till Overwatch arrives, look no further.

reviewText:
It's a very funny game with loads of jokes (some even breaks the 4th wall). Very colourful and vibrant worlds and characters which makes it entertaining and pleasant.

Gameplay: 8
Soundtrack: 7
Story: 7
Multiplayer: 7 (lack of player base for Asia)
Overall: 7.3

Pros:
1. 26 Battleborn (Alani just released for preorder and beta. So much fun with Alani, after a long playthrough of Ambra)
2. Unique lore (only one with audio log)
3. Loads of Gears for your loadout
4. Boss fights are tough (alone that is)
5. Charateristics of each battleborn are distinct and unique
6. Rewarded a Legend Gear for each character lore completed
7. An ingame marketplace where you can buy up to Unique Gear Pack (with a high chance for legend)
8. LOADS of Titles and Achievements

50/50
1. Everyone is always in Incursion for PvP (in Asia)
2. Story is a little jumpy (in terms of plot flow)

Cons:
1. Small player base
2. Long wait for players in other PVP matches (referring to Asia player base)
3. The screen resolution bug (keeps switching resolution back to a smaller one)
4. Some minor bugs in story missions
5. Game requires you (the player) to be online to play
